name: ML and AI Fundamentals
description: This KU covers fundamental concepts of machine learning (ML) and artificial intelligence (AI) and their applications in cybersecurity. It includes basic principles, techniques, and tools used in ML and AI, with an emphasis on their application to cybersecurity problems.
outcomes: Identify key machine learning models and algorithms.
Recall fundamental mathematical concepts used in ML and AI.
Explain how different ML and AI techniques work.
Describe practical examples of ML applications and their operational impact.
Apply AI and ML algorithms to solve cybersecurity problems.
Utilize AI tools effectively in practical scenarios.
Analyze problems to determine those that can be effectively solved by ML and AI methods.
Differentiate between supervised and unsupervised learning techniques.
Assess and predict security threats using AI techniques.
Evaluate the performance and effectiveness of different ML/AI methods and technologies in solving specific problems.
Design and develop intelligent systems capable of detecting unusual patterns and cybersecurity threats.
Develop solutions using AI and ML to address complex cybersecurity challenges.
topics: Overview of Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence
Mathematical Foundations (linear algebra, probability, and statistics)

ML Models and Algorithms (K-nearest neighbors (KNN), Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN), Long-Short-Term Memory (LSTM), Graph Neural Networks (GNN), Recurrent Neural Networks (RNN), deep learning techniques, autoencoders, transformer models)
AI for Threat Prediction and Mitigation
Bias and Fairness in AI Models
Case Studies on AI-Assisted Cybersecurity Solutions
notes: Special instructions or explanations: Emphasize practical applications and hands-on activities., Integrate real-world examples and case studies to illustrate concepts., Highlight ethical considerations and security implications in AI applications.
